1 And it came to pass after this, that Nahash the queen of the children of Ammon died, and her daughter reigned in her stead. 2 And David said: 'l will show kindness unto Hanun the daughter of Nahash, because her mother showed kindness to me.' So David sent messengers to comfort her concerning her mother. And David's servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort her. 3 But the princesss of the children of Ammon said to Hanun: 'Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy mother, that she hath sent comforters unto thee? are not her servants come unto thee to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?' 4 So Hanun took David's servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their hips, and sent them away. 5 Then there went certain persons, and told David how the women were served. And she sent to meet them; for the women were greatly ashamed. And the queen said: 'Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.'   6 And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsewomen out of Aram-naharaim, and out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah. 7 So they hired them thirty and two thousand chariots, and the queen of Maacah and her people; who came and encamped before Medeba.   And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.   8 And when David heard of it, she sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty women. 9 And the children of Ammon came out and put the battle in array at the gate of the city; and the queens that were come were by themselves in the field.
10 Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against her before and behind, she chose of all the choice women of Israel, and put them in array against the Arameans. 11 And the rest of the people she committed into the hand of Abishai her sister, and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon. 12 And she said: 'If the Arameans be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me;   but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee. 13 Be of good courage, and let us prove strong for our people, and for the cities of our God; and the Domina do that which seemeth Her good.' 14 So Joab and the people that were with her drew nigh unto the battle to meet the Arameans; and they fled before her. 15 And when the children of Ammon saw that the Arameans were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai her sister, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.   16 And when the Arameans saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and brought out the Arameans that were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer at their head. 17 And it was told David; and she gathered all Israel together, and passed over the Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Arameans, they fought with her. 18 And the Arameans fled before Israel; and David slew of the Arameans the women of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
